message: http://techcrunch.com/2011/02/07/path-comments/
I use path
but I never used the emotes
I've never really understood what Path had to offer, any insight?
I guess I like it because I can control who sees my stuff
it's more private
6a should have stripped features from Vox, given it an entirely new name, then released it as a new product
@leah I can see that. Unfortunately I haven't really used it. I should give it another go.
I like the *idea* behind path: a social network for your very closest friends.
Where you can feel free to share anything and everything
@ericflo until Path pisses off Anonymous and suddenly you are in your skimpy's on TechCrunch :D
i won't really trust any social network until there's one i can pay for
I actually can't believe I have like 12 friends on path
I mean, I feel like a lot of people I know use path but not that many people overall
@leah you're the only person I know on it so I don't really get it yet. Interesting the update said it was 'chat' not 'comments', though.
@ericflo wow, really?
yeah, that's an odd term to use
seems like a lot!
@leah you're very well-connected, don't be shy
i actually don't know anyone who uses path, which surprises me, since I know more than a few early adopters

@djchall my friends who use path are all working in startups... I kind of think that working at a very early stage startup makes you sympathetic to other really early stage startups and more willing to try their stuff
and I've actually only had one non-friend add me on path
so far
i feel like path may be falling into the trap of doing things differently just to be different
you can only share with 50 people so you can't just share with everyone
yeah, you can "mute" though
which compared with every other social site is just crazy
@ericflo that might be the trick
yeah
then again, *all* my friends used Dodgeball (pre-Foursquare) and it only had 70k users so maybe my friends are just a weird case
Yeah the somewhat weird thing about Path is that people can friend you without your consent. Considering their mission as "social network for your closest friends" I find that slightly weird.
Then again their stuff is so pretty I kind of forget about any misgivings I have with their product :)
like how did they encourage only real friendships so well?
@djchall perhaps
@leah they limit it to 50 friends
Thanks for the conversation everyone. @leah great job with convore.

To whomever designed the user experience : Great job! Just don't further complicate it and make sure the search function works fast and accurate over 1000+ people groups with multiple hundred man year blog content.  It would also be great if there was a wiki option.

@asenchi I am simply a huge fan of anything that cares more about the 'social' in 'social network' and 'social media'. As everything gets noisier and noisier, I believe actual people (i.e. 'users') are going to spend increasing amount of time with the tools that provide the most personal value. I will not be surprised when the gap widens between personal tools and news/marketing tools.
Great UI. A huge inspiration for the Pinterest app which should also rock!
